review: I haven't been here for a couple of years so was looking forward to lunch. I remembered the burgers and fries being fantastic. Sadly, the quality has changed. They serve steak fries. I prefer a larger cut fry, crispy outside and soft inside. Their fries and just soft all over. I wouldn't say they are not cooked, but cooking another 20-30 seconds would help tremendously. The burgers are bland and lack seasoning. I got a burger with blue cheese, wing sauce and celery straws. The wing sauce had no heat, there was very little blue cheese (you could barely taste it) and the celery straws were not crunchy. The macaroni and cheese was disgusting. The noodles were terribly overcooked and the cheese sauce was describable. I was really shocked by how the quality of food has declined here. The service was spectacular. The waitress took good care of us. Making sure we had plenty of the endless fries, refills and offering to go drinks. Although the service is really good, the food is not worth a visit.

Overall Red Robin is great if you want to get in for a quick lunch and want dependable tasting food. This location provides that no problem, where they lack sometimes is service. I recently started working in the vicinity of this location so I have been going once or twice a week, half of the time my servers have been spot on the other half I have almost walked out on my check due to being ignored.  The restaurant and restrooms are clean and you are always greeted warmly when you walk in the door.  If the service becomes more consistent the review will improve but as of right now I think this is a mediocre location.

"Unbelievable" wouldn't be able to describe my experience tonight, from the time I walked in to the restaurant, to the time i went to their website to leave them my constructive criticism!!  I AM SO DONE with Red Robin!  Here we go.... I searched their web site for something that I could carry out  that was gluten free.  I decided on an "Avo Cabo Salad"; minus the blue cheese chunks of course.  I called to place my order for carry out at 7:40 local time (on Sunday evening), and was told it would be ready in 15 minutes.  When I arrived @ 8:11, (31 minutes later), they told me my SALAD would be ready shortly.  Really?  It's a salad.  It's not ready?  And as I look around the restaurant, I notice that it's not quite a morgue, but maybe it's on it's way....   Okay, so I wait for it to be brought out, and I suppose the manager thought that they may have fallen short of the goal because she brought it out herself.  When I leave with my order, i discover that they have packaged a piece of warm foccacia (sp?) bread with my cold salad in the SAME bag!  I know... why do I care about the bread because I can't eat wheat?  I just don't get why you'd package anything warm with anything cold.  And furthermore, I get NO fork with which to eat my salad!  Really?  Are you kidding me? Okay, I am NEVER one to do a survey or leave my opinion...so why am I doing so here you ask?  It's because when my chain gets rattled so much, I just want to see justice be served!  I won't even go in to the trouble that I had when I TRIED to leave my constructive criticism on their website! Did I say that "I AM SO DONE" with Red Robin?

One of my friends said, "I can't imagine why anyone without kids would to to Red Robin." Well, you go there when you're meeting your in-laws who have kids. And, guess what, everyone can find something on the menu to nosh on.  Red Robin is alright. I went with a fried chicken sandwich - not a culinary delight, but good none-the-less. As I understand, they offer unlimited french fries. The kids loved the experience - especially the chocolate shakes.  Will I go back? The next time we meet up with the in-laws.
Good menu selection although somewhat overpriced.  I recommend ordering the petite burger for a reduced rate and size.
Better than the Red Robin on 135th. Friendlier staff and easier to get to, right off I-35.

Went on a midweek date with my husband to this location.  This was my first visit to a RR, and the food was good.  I started out with the mini wedge salad and it was tasty with bleu cheese and fried onion strings, and a good price at 3 bucks.  For the main event, I ordered the Royal Red (?) burger and it was to die for.  Lovely and well seasoned patty topped with lettuce and tomato, cheese, bacon, and a perfectly cooked sunny side up egg.  The "bottomless" fries were good from the few I ate... I was stuffed after the burger!  For the food alone, I would go to a RR again without a doubt.  HOWEVER.  :)  We came after the dinner rush and either there was no manager or just a really lax one on duty.  There were unoccupied employees sitting around for literally the entire time we were there.  At one point there was a table of five workers laughing loudly, a girl in uniform who appeared to be on a date and a table of two employees having a deep conversation a few tables down.  They were disruptive to the few actual patrons that were there, and I felt bad for the employees that were actually working.  Someone should have sent the extras all home probably well before we got there.  They were annoying and made the place feel inefficient. Our waitress was endlessly polite and bubbly but a bit flaky, and I think she was probably getting some social time in as well.  The simple starter salad I ordered was most likely forgotten by her until our burgers were ready because it came out literally a minute before the burgers, so even though my burger tasted awesome, it was cooler than I'd like by the time I got to it.  We had to ask for things twice and we wouldn't see her for long stretches at a time. Overall the food made it worth the visit but I'd like to go again to see if its normally that unorganized or if we just caught it on a weird night.  If its like that again,I'll probably stick with other locations.

Not bad for a quick bite to eat. They  offer a great variety of burgers and more. One of the best places to go if you have kids. They are very kid friendly and they have a good kid menu. Most of the time service is good, but I've had bad service from time to time. I also order Togo just because we have small children and it easier. The order is always quick and ready to go when we show up. Never had a bad meal from here.

We had eaten it in Seattle and were pretty excited when it opened here.  Back then we used to eat here quite a bit.  Nowadays, we come maybe once a year?!?   The food here is decent.  I remember it being better in the past, but still not bad.  Service is usually good too.  We still stop by when we are craving onion rings and fries with honey mustard and ranch.  This last time we decided to get fried zucchini and they just weren't as good as I remembered.  For some reason they thought it was a good idea to have a 1:1 ratio for batter to zucchini?  Their soups are still yummy.  I can never decide between the clam chowder or tortilla soup!
Very nice staff and great food. Prices are reasonable. Super quick service. They were nice and didn't charge us for the fries they brought out right away.

Decent burgers and they even have Gluten Free buns.  Ask for the Fries to be Gluten Free because the seasonings are not (so we had a couple baskets at the table). The GF buns were a bit on the dry side so I ended up eating my burger steak-style. Also, the GF buns cost extra.  My grandson devoured his corn dog and fries. Although they were busy we still got right in.

My husband ordered a cheese burger, he was served a hamburger, our waiter offered to get some cheese, which was cold and did not really melt on the burger. I order a salad with grilled chicken, my chicken was not fully cooked.  Our waiter got me a new salad; however he never sent a manager to perhaps give us a discount for these two issues. We will not be back.

So, if you call and ask if they take checks they will tell you they take checks...but they don't. Maybe the people answering the phone should be trained on answering those types of questions correctly. Food was fine and service was okay.

I went here a couple months ago with my friend. The waitress so Aaaaamaing! Wish I remembered her name. Came her yesterday and we had this waitress that barley did anything. It was not busy she did not come over to check on us, my friend asked for more fries and the waitress never put I in then when it came time to get our check she was just very rude. Can't wait for school to be back in.....

Yummmm! The bonsai burger is my all-time favorite of any burger I've eaten anywhere! Red Robin is always consistent with the perfect burger, excellent fries (and a delicious onion ring tower too). The wait staff is always friendly, prompt and efficient. The restaurant is always clean, tidy and welcoming though can get loud on a busy night (which is normal and not a reason for me to stay away)

This Red Robin is a little off the beaten path, but worth a visit if you are looking for a quick lunch or dinner. I've been to some of the "fancy" burger places in the metro, and Red Robin's offerings are comparable for about half the price. I've had a few little issues here and there at this location, but they are normally corrected very quickly.

Me and my boys love going here! Sometimes service is a little hit and miss.  Over all food is great.  Biggest complaint is their tea. It is disgusting.  Tastes like it's old.  I always send it back and nothing gets done. Fun atmosphere.

Jamie and I met her high school buds here, and the joint was jumpin' on Saturday night, 12/27.  There was a wait for tables, so we sat at the big elevated table in the bar, ordered up drinks, and commenced our eve.  Here's what we got: Ambiance:  pleasant, with a modern (for a family burger bar) bright colored decor, a nice smattering of TV's for viewing the sport du jour Service: solid, with our waitress never too far away, or away for too long Food:  Most of us had burgers, which were solid, comparable to Chili's, cooked to order well balanced creations. Drinks:  I was pleased with my $5.50 23 oz jumbo frosty glass Lagunitas IPA, but the gals thought their mixed drinks were weak.  At $4.29 per drink, this was disappointing, but not enough for them to stop ordering more :) Good family friendly place for a burger, drink and watching a game, if you are in need of such a place.  If I lived around one, I would be a regular, 2-3 times per month, kind of customer.  Solid food, good value, nice overall experience.

The food was good, but our waitress must have been new. I also think the bottomless fries are a lie, because we had some before our food and in the little container with our meals and then NO FRIES FOR YOU! Also, we asked twice for the campfire sauce and only got one tiny cup for three people. The waitress was friendly, but not on top of her game and the hostess was rude. (We all get it, no one wants to be at Red Robin on V-Day, but let's make the best of it, okaaay?)

I went there on Mother's Day, the burger was cold, the bottomless fries meant 10 fries in one basket and never received another after asking 3 servers for more fries. I'm not sure if I will ever give it a second try.

Just ok. Burger. 5 out of 10. Soggy weak ass bun! too much mayo and no wonder the fries are all you can eat. They are soggy and not piping hot-Maybe from another table.   Won't be back Update:  5/1/17 Still sucks!
Got the teriyaki chicken burger... Bad mistake!  Stick with the burgers not chicken!  Tasted like something from A gas station!

Red Robin is a great place to just come in and relax.  The food is great, the people are on the ball and I would recommend going there as a spur of the moment pace to go to.  There is always room and great food here! Allons-y!
I was excited that they have a GF menu. Too bad it takes two or three times for them to get your order right. Too many high school kids serving tables.

Got a free burger and fry side for the month of my birthday by signing up for their rewards. I called in my order 20 minutes before closing, but they were happy to get me a to go order. Order was ready in 10 minutes, and I was greeted by happy faces at the door. I ordered the gourmet cheeseburger, and it tasted alright--nothing too special. The burger was a bit mushy, including the patty and the bun. Fries are thick cut steak fries.

Good food. Service is also good. I am not a fan of siting in the bar area because if your not drinking like a fish then your kind of ignored if there are people that are. I always eat here and I have never been disappointed by the food, sometimes disappointed by the service.

We usually get take-out from Red Robin because it's usually terribly loud in the restaurant. Even when we've been on slow nights, somehow the ambient noise level is loud. It must be the architecture or materials used. Sometimes it's impossible to carry on a conversation without yelling at each other.  The food, however is usually very good.  We usually stick with what we know is good. I have the Gourmet Cheeseburger and my wife has the BLTA. They are consistently good and rarely is our order not to our specifications. The only complaint is that they sometimes skimp on the fries. That's not a problem when dining in because you can just ask for more.  However, when you get home and find that you have an equivalent of a small order of fries, it's a little disappointing.

Food is good, always is here. The wait and staff are why they don't 4 stars. We ordered sweet potato fries and got regular, asked twice for them to fix it and they never did. We waited forever for our check it took 20 mins for the check alone and we were on our lunch break. My coworker also looked at the electronic menu thing and it charged us $1.99 for a game we didn't play. They had to fix our ticket twice after waiting 20 mins already. Finally the waitress came back with 3 tickets showing she fixed it and then showed us how to run the credit card through the electronic thing on the table. If they fix their service I would give them 4 starts. The food and drinks are great. Well when the bring the right food.

It takes extraordinary talent to ruin a staple sandwich as a burger. I ordered the Black & Bleu, which is supposed to be a blackened hamburger patty, dressed and with bleu cheese crumbles. Despite ordering it cooked medium, mine was overdone and they didn't break the bank with a smidgen of bleu cheese on top. It make take great convincing to return, not even for the unending fries, which were the better part of the meal.

Every town needs one of these places if you drive by one it's worth the upturn ticket for sure. Just do yourself a favor and go to a red Robbins. You must get the steak fries and I bet you leave with a bottle of there seasoning.

They CRANK the AC on Saturday to get you to leave faster!  I worked in the restaurant industry back in the day and "it is all about butts in seats" was a quote I heard that stuck meaning customer service isnt a priority they just want you in and out to maximize profits.  Ithink thats why they wont turn the AC off.  Its like 79 outside and 50 inside and a lot of seats are under a vent where its got a pretty heavy chill. I asked the manager to please turn off the vent it was so cold she wouldn't stand by the vent.  She said her manager gave her a nasty look when she asked. I'm not saying don't come, the food is good.  Service is good.  Bring a hoodie, make sure everyone has extra layers, take your time, wite a review keep your butt in their chair if you come.  But layer up.
Excellent as always,  fish and chips were great along with a red wine.  A place you can always count on to relax at.

BEST. FLIPPIN'. RESTAURANT. I went there with my mother for lunch. I had a bacon cheeseburger (11/10) with fries. We had mud pie dessert as well (unhealthily fattening but SO GOOD). We had good service, delicious food, and nice waiters. 15/10, would recommend.

I like Red Robins a lot but tonight it wasn't that great! Asked for fries a little crisper but came back with most looking like they soaked up the oil. Ask for some more that wasn't crisped and got a better order. The manager there is so cool just love her to pieces ( Liz) she makes my visit there the best even if I didn't like it. I will go back I am royal card holder. So I like getting a free item once in a while. LoL

Its like this place like this u like or not like or whatever, I go because of bartender Kelsey, she is from st.louis and very nice, or bartender are nice here, Food is good and they are getting in the big boys beer not u cheap beer, Greg is another bartender that is very nice and will talk if not busy, the owner wife would order food and is very nice and will talk to the staff, not stuck up like most owners are, that right there I will support a business for that purpose, I use to work at a place like that and I give more lead way than most people do,they have special people that will clean tables or greet u at the door, which is great and sorry if I didn't say it right but they are great people to know

Since my previous review in 2011, I have frequented this location and it's become too inconsistent to ever return. The service is incredibly spotty, with service in the bar being the absolute worst. I go here specifically because I want to binge eat excessive orders of french fries, so I get upset when sometimes the server keeps em coming and sometimes they have excuses like the fries aren't ready yet. My last visit was the final straw for me. I ordered my burger medium well and it came out medium rare. I told my server, and he said they would make me a new one, but that it would "be a while." No apology, no rushing the order, just a bunch of inconsiderate lackadaisical employees. After 15 minutes and everyone finishing their meals, I received another medium rare burger and still no one cared. I asked to speak to the manager and while I was explaining that the burger was cooked improperly twice and everyone else was finished eating, she just kept cutting me off saying "right, right" and nothing else. It was really weird. Some of the servers like Bekka & Kelsey are good, but evidently no one else cares about custies.

When you're super hungry and don't have time to drive anywhere good, we found ourselves at Red Robin. And let me tell you-we we're pleasantly surprised by our visit!  Our waitress Carrie was the best in town at any restaurant. She was SO good. Sweet, on the ball, helpful. We were both happy with the A1 burger cooked medium and Banazi burger with Boca substitute. Fries were always hot and plentiful. My only complaint was the amount of crumbs on the floor was a little much.

Thankful for another Red Robin in an area with very few restaurants remaining after the local mall was demo'd this summer.   The Avo Cobb O salad was fresh and tasty as usual.   Staff was not the most friendly I've encountered at RR's, but they did their jobs.

When you're looking for a burger, they will satisfy your needs. The menu is not particularly creative, but does have a variety of options. They bring you bottomless basket of fries upon ordering if you ask. I choose to dip mine in their amazing house ranch (I could drink the stuff) and my husband likes their campfire sauce.  I typically order my burger 'lettuce-wrapped', and they always give plenty of iceberg so it really functions as a bun. Cocktails are great but their signature drinks are overpriced like many of their competitors. Great family place, but it is a bit noisy.

Service was terrible I really truly believe it's there job to walk around and act busy so they never have to make any contact with the customer especially eye contact at the table and god forbid they take any plates off the table that's not going to happen asked twice for beer glass for beers that were ordered only could bring one, burgers were just ok buns were so stale and dry they crumbled apart before you could even take your first bite! Onions straws and fries were soaked in grease unbelievable. You have a bunch of young kids working this place with no one managing any if them, oh but wait they do like to sing happy birthday and then scatter not to be seen again! Totally stay away from this place.
Ehhh. Overpriced. Wait, wait & wait. Hardly any fries-mostly cold. Will spend my cash elsewhere. Not as good as it used to be!!

Love Red Robin food in general. This location is always clean and does a great job of getting food orders correct. My carry out orders are always correct! When I have dinned in my order is always right and food is delivered prompt hot and fresh. This location is always clean and employees act as though the my care about their customers. I eat out a lot and I can tell you this location sets the bar high! Keep up the good work Olathe Red Robin!!

We visited on 12/30/17, the food was good, service less than impressive. First our server got my  order wrong, then we had to ask twice for sugar for our iced tea, and when we asked for some more supposedly "bottomless fries,", they never arrived. Waited about 15 minutes and find decided to leave and then it took forever to get our server back over there so we could even leave! I understand it was busy but we were just not impressed at all.
What a great visit for lunch.  Staff was very personable and accommodating.  Good was quick and hot.  Just what we needed for a quick lunch.
